title: Fans Catch CAT Plummeting from Stadium
description:
'Fans Catch CAT Plummeting from Stadium'

Fans watched in terror, as a cat clung to the upper tier of a stadium. The cat hung from a single claw as people frantically prepared a soft landing. All eyes turned from the game to the tense situation in the stalls. As the cat plummeted to the seats below, fans caught it in an American flag.

title: Exploding sperm whale Carcass caught on camera in The Faroe Islands!
description:
A camera captured the moment a sperm whale carcass, which washed up in the Faroe Islands, exploded. The clip, which was shown of Faroese Television, has since gone viral, racking up millions of hits on YouTube alone. The dead whale had been lying on the beach for two days, after getting stuck in the waters between two islands, when marine biologist Bjarni Mikkelsen was sent to cut it open. As he made incisions in the whale's side the carcass exploded due to a buildup of methane gas from the decomposition creating a loud sound and releasing a pungent smell. It is reported that a local museum will collect the skeleton and put it on display. Report by Laurie Blake.

title: Kim Jong-un gives Vladimir Putin a SWORD at final summit dinner
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un have attended a dinner following their much-anticipated summit.  The Russia President presented Kim with a tea set. In return, Putin was gifted with a ceremonial sword. Putin and Kim said they had good talks about their joint efforts to resolve a standoff over Pyongyang's nuclear program, amid stalled negotiations with the United States. Kim's first trip to Russia comes about two months after his second summit with US President Donald Trump failed because of disputes over US-led sanctions on the North. Putin meanwhile wants to expand Russia's clout in the region and get more leverage with Washington.

#VladimirPutin #KimJongUn #Summit

Report by Lily Thomas.

title: Fastest 100m in high heels in Guinness World Record attempt
description:
Running in high heels has the potential of leaving you with a broken shoe. However, a woman from Germany has avoided the 'unthinkable' and broken a world record instead. Julia Plecher, from Ruckersdorf, has run 100 metres in 14.531 seconds, wearing shiny golden heels. She has raced into the Guinness World Records and has been included in its 2014 book.

Julia has a history of running in heels. She took part in a 'stiletto race' in Berlin back in 2009, and despite the rule being a seven centimetre heel, she chose an 8.5 cm one. She ended up winning the race.

Julia has previously said the key to not falling over is unsurprisingly now the show is made.

"You need shoes which ideally are closed in the front because you run on the front part of the foot. You have to be careful not to slip out. I think sandals would not be too appropriate," Plecher said. Report by Ashley Fudge.

title: Footage of Couple Kidnapped by Somali Pirates
description:
'Footage of Couple Kidnapped by Somali Pirates'

Paul and Rachel Chandler, the British couple kidnapped by Somali pirates, say their captors are "losing patience" as they wait for ransom negotiations to begin. 

In October 2009 the Chandlers set sail from the Seychelles for Tanzania. Ninety miles offshore, their small yacht was boarded by armed Somali pirates, who held them hostage on land for more than a year, demanding a ransom of millions.

They were held hostage for 388 days and freed when a private ransom was paid, mostly be members of their extended family.

#Somalia #Pirates #Footage

title: World's First Face and Hand Transplant Surgery Hailed a Success
description:
'World's First Face and Hand Transplant Surgery Hailed a Success'

A 22-year-old man has undergone the world‚Äôs first face and double hand transplant.

The New Jersey resident was severely burned in a horrific car crash.

The reconstructive plastic surgery, carried out by a team at New York University‚Äôs Langone Health, took 23 hours.

It Included transplanting both hands and the full face of a single organ donor.

The operation marked the first ever successful combination transplant of its kind.

The patient was Joe DiMeo, who suffered burns over 80 percent of his body in 2018.

#Transplant #Surgery #NewYork

title: Little Girl Lost: More than 600 people ignore lost child in TV experiment
description:
In a social experiment for a TV documentary 616 people were filmed walking past two young girls, who were left alone in a London shopping centre. Seven-year-old Uma Rumsey and her sister, Maya, who's five, were taken to Victoria Place shopping centre, next to Victoria Station. They were left alone separately - but with tight security around them - obviously alone and looking in need of help. The cameras recorded men and women clearly seeing them - and ignoring them. A total of 616 adults passed them by in just one hour. The one person who did finally ask Maya if she needed help did so only after doubling back and making sure the child was alone. She was Pearl Pitcher, who said: "I was very hesitant to come and ask her, but I thought I must come back - just in case. I think the older generation would stop, but very cautiously, a bit like I was". A spokesman for the NSPCC said: "We have got to get a message out to adults that they have a responsibility to protect children and that must supersede any concern you have for other people's perception of why you are reaching out to help that child". The experiment, which was to test the public's reaction to lost children, was carried out for a programme by ITN Productions on Channel 5, called "Little Girl Lost: A Police 5 Special", which will air on Tuesday 25th March at 6.30pm. Report by Lauren Hood.

title: Italian landslide: Huge boulders destroy buildings in South Tyrol
description:
Subscribe to ITN News: http://bit.ly/1bmWO8h
Footage has captured the devastation after huge boulders crashed through and destroyed a barn in northern Italy. An estimated four thousand cubic meters of rock came loose from a cliff face above the site, before destroying most of the 300-year-old building. Huge scars were left in the hillside where the jagged rocks had rolled, with surrounding vineyards also left badly damaged. No one was injured in the incident. Report by Sophie Foster.

title: Climate Protesters Block Boris Johnson‚Äôs Motorcade on Way to Buckingham Palace
description:
Climate protesters have tried to block incoming prime minister Boris Johnson's journey down The Mall as he travelled to Buckingham Palace for an audience with the Queen.

Mr Johnson's motorcade stopped briefly as it met the demonstration, where people wearing red t-shirts formed a human chain to block the passage.

Police intervened to move the protesters away and let Johnson's convoy proceed.

title: Final flight of wingsuit diver Victor Kovats caught on camera
description:
Subscribe to ITN News: http://bit.ly/itnytsub
The final flight of wingsuit diver Victor Kovats has been shown on Chinese state television. The Hungarian flyer died when his parachute failed to deploy after he jumped from a mountain cliff 100 metres high up in Zhangjiajie National Park on Tuesday. State news agency Xinhau reported around 200 firefighters and police officers were involved in the search for his body. Initial investigations said the cause of Kovats' accident may have been a "technical problem during the trial." Kovats was an experienced wingsuit flyer having completed 700 flights and 125 skydives since taking up the sport 6 years ago. He was due to take part in the second World Wingsuit Championship this week in Tianmen mountain where participants have to jump from 700-metre-high cliffs. Report by Ashley Fudge.

description:

With just weeks to go until the US election in November, Joe Biden's gaffes are still making headlines. He recently struggled to describe the impact of coronavirus at a rally in Pittsburgh, saying: ‚ÄúCOVID has taken this year just since the outbreak, has taken more than 100 years ‚Äì look, here's the lives it's just it's just, I mean, think about it".

But with Joe Biden defending a steady lead in the polls against President Donald Trump, will his gaffes get in the way of his bid for the White House?

title: Queen arrives at Margaret Thatcher's funeral
description:
The Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh were among the final guests to arrive for Baroness Thatcher's funeral. They got to St Paul's Cathedral around fifteen minutes before the service was due to begin at 11am. The National Anthem was played by the Band of the Welsh Guards as the Queen's car arrived at the cathedral's entrance. It is the first time the monarch has attended the funeral service of a former prime minister since Sir Winston Churchill's state ceremony in 1965. Report by Sophie Foster.

title: Shocking video: Massive crocodile chases swimmer in Mexico
description:
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/ODNsubs
Amateur footage has emerged showing a swimmer frantically trying to reach the beach while being chased by a giant crocodile in Mexico. Panicked tourists on the overhanging Boca Paila bridge in Sian Ka'an watched in terror, as the man made a beeline for dry land. A quick-thinking observer intervened, throwing an object at the creature and stopping it in its tracks. The footage is said to be captured by Manuel Carrera. Report by Sarah Kerr.

title: Joe Biden's Most Awkward Gaffes Of All Time (Part 1)
description:
Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden once described himself as a ‚Äúgaffe machine‚Äù and we have to agree. Here‚Äôs a hilarious collection of epic awkward moments throughout his career in politics.

From several out-of-place jokes to some seriously unfortunate incidents, former Vice-President Biden's goofiness is either considered charming or alarming by the US electorate. 

Ironically, in 2008 Mr Biden said that Hillary Clinton is ‚Äúmore qualified than I am to be Vice-President of the United States of America.‚Äù

Maybe it helps that the then-President Barack Obama reacted to most of his gaffes with bemusement. 

However, could some of these embarrassing moments make his race for the White House against incumbent President Donald Trump more difficult? 

#JoeBiden #Biden2020 #DonaldTrump

Report by Gianluca Avagnina.

description:
Audio recordings between British and Iranian naval forces and the recently captured Stena Impero reveal attempts by the battleship HMS Montrose to stop Iranian forces from capturing the British flagged tanker.

The Stena Impero was forced to change course by Iranian naval forces in the Strait of Hormuz. 

The British HMS Montrose was not able to reach the Impero before it entered Iranian waters.

title: Funny moments you missed from the Trump-Kim summit
description:
Here are some of the lighter moments from the Trump-Kim summit in Hanoi. The highlights include jogging bodyguards, a Kim Jong-un lookalike being deported and Kim having a smoke break as his sister holds a crystal ashtray. Also we see Trump frantically waving a Vietnam flag and seemingly understanding Kim's jokes, even though Korean leader spoke in his native tongue. We see the pair enjoying a 'private dinner' in front of the gathered media, including one of the "world's greatest photographers". After the summit ended with no agreement we see Trump having an awkward moment with a bunch of flowers then stumbling slightly as enters Air Force One.

Report by Matt Blair.

#TrumpKimSummit, #HanoiSummit2019, #HanoiSummit, #DonaldTrump, #KimJongUn

title: The BATTLE for Kyiv: Russians Reach The City
description:
The day that many feared would never come has arrived far sooner than anyone expected. 

After a night of intense shelling on the Ukrainian capital, Russian operatives are now in Kyiv.

Heavy gunfire and explosions intensified in the lead up to their arrival as a brutal battle began.

The Ukrainian Defence Ministry urged citizens to make molotov cocktails to fend off the attackers.

Report by Marina Petrus 

#Ukraine #Russia

title: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: People jump from 20-storey building in Pakistan to escape fire
description:
At least four people were killed and several injured as they tried to escape a fire in an office building in Lahore, Pakistan. The fire started at around noon on the 7th and 8th floors of the building and rapidly engulfed three more floors, trapping several people inside.

Horrified onlookers watched from the street below as those in the building waved for help from the smoke-filled rooms.

Two men were filmed jumping from the building rather than face the flames. One died on impact and the other later in hospital.  Report by Matt Blake.

title: Gareth Bale with Cristiano Ronaldo on first day of training at Real Madrid
description:
After playing 30 minutes for Wales on Tuesday, Gareth Bale finally joined up with his new Real Madrid team-mates on Wednesday. Video released by the club showed a smiling Bale being greeted by team-mate Cristiano Ronaldo as he arrived at the Valdebebas training ground.

He was then greeted by manager Carlo Ancelotti and his assistant Zinedine Zidane at a pre-training session in a meeting room.

Bale then joined the rest of players for a two-hour session, where he met up with his former Spurs team-mate Luka Modric.

Only Ancelotti, and perhaps his coaching staff, know whether Bale will make his debut during Saturday's La Liga match against Villarreal.

But Wales boss Chris Coleman said on Wednesday that Bale is not fit enough to play a full 90 minutes.

Real have won their opening three La Liga matches under Ancelotti, who replaced Jose Mourinho at the end of last season. Report by Mark Morris.

title: Can this basketball-playing robot beat the professionals?
description:
Japanese engineers have developed a basketball robot built to take precision three-point shots. It only hit five out of eight on a test trial.
It still beat its human competitors though, two basketball players who are likely to compete for the Japanese team in the Tokyo 2020 Olympics
The robot‚Äôs developers say CUE3 still has a long way to go. 

Report by Ferdia Carr

title: Man with tree-like warts all over his body receives the first operation to treat them
description: Medical staff in Bangladesh have performed the first surgery to treat 'tree man illness'. Report by Jennifer Cordingley.
